channel.title: Bittorrent metafile and tracker response parser
channel.description:
I thought making a Bittorrent client would be a pretty fun Java project to embark on, and it is. This is what I have so far (as it's still in process), and all it does is parse the metafile that you specify,
(in org.wc.bittorrent.Main) [code]MetaFile metaFile = MetaFile.parse("torrent metafile name here");[/code]
, contact the tracker, and parse the list of peers that it sends back. I suggest that you use a metafile from demonoid.com, since I know that they support compact peer lists (http://wiki.theory.org/BitTorrentSpecification#Tracker_Request_Parameters). I know that it's not the best code on the planet, but it works and I'll soon get around to touching it up. Feel free to expand on it!
P.S.: torrent metafiles are those ".torrent" files.

item.title: Bittorrent metafile and tracker response parser
item.dc:creator: @k00dr k00dr
item.description:
@k00dr wrote:

Good job

I made an application to boost my and a friend’s ratio on this private torrent site about a year ago.
It was pretty neat being a megaleecher

Read full topic
